section1.desc1: Despite this being a “testimony” website, we often struggle to define it!

section2.desc1Main: “Public testimony” used to be the sole avenue for influencing legislation and creating a record of legislative discussions and intent. But not anymore!

section3.desc1Main: A “tweet” or viral video can influence legislation (and often does), and civic debate has moved from meeting halls to online forums and feeds.

section4.desc1Main: While “public testimony” may seem archaic, its underlying goals remain imperative – influencing legislation and documenting legislative discussions.

section5.desc1Main: Whatever the manifestation of political expression - whether a tweet, post, public comment or testimony - these expressions are essential.

section6.desc1Main: Perhaps just as essential is the space that elicits, houses and shares those political expressions.

section7.desc1Main: We, at MAPLE, do not take this responsibility lightly, and neither should you.

section8.desc1Main: However, you should not be intimidated by the phrase “public testimony”. It should not conjure much more uncomfortability than sharing a tweet or post.
